cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 160 mi SSE of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Drifting slowly north-northwest, expected to turn northwest and move inland near the SC/NC border late Saturday, then lift northward and recurve northeast along (but mainly just offshore of) the U.S. Mid-Atlantic coast, passing east of the Delmarva/Baltimore area Monday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South Carolina coast (around Myrtle Beach)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect Edisto Beach SC to Cape Lookout NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coast from South Carolina through North Carolina this weekend, then the Mid-Atlantic to New England coasts early next week
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (<10%) of tropical-storm-force gusts Sunday night–Monday; breezy conditions expected
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected in Baltimore Harbor; any surge should remain below 1 ft
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands could bring 1–2 in of rain Sunday night through Monday, locally higher in thunderstorms
weather_observation.other_hazards: Enhanced rip currents and minor coastal/Chesapeake Bay flooding possible during high tide cycles
